dublin_core.dcvalue: Learn about and discuss emerging findings from a systematic narrative review on using mobile technology to improve uptake of HIV testing in vulnerable populations Hear more related to design statistical efficacy and sustainability of mHealth solutions for HIV test initiation in low middle and high income countries Attendees will benefit from a case analysis of mobile technological opportunities and failures in community based intervention trials experiencing null findings the presentation will touch on qualitative themes relating to cost communication and mHealth system linkages for reducing the global proportion of undiagnosed persons living with HIV Next learn about mAdapt a research project which connects mobile phone users with culturally sensitive country and language specific information intended to address the reproductive health needs of refugee women and girls in key European cities Presented by Rebeccah Bartlett Co Founder CEO mAdapt
Reaching Underserved Populations: M(obile) Health for M(obile) Populations
